name: BrandPulse Calendar
description: An AI‑powered content calendar that ingests brand guidelines, audience insights, and upcoming events to automatically generate, schedule, and store social‑media post copy for multiple platforms. Marketers can ask the assistant to create weekly plans, adjust tone, or pull analytics, while the LLM orchestrates specialized tools to fetch data, generate copy, schedule posts, and maintain the calendar.

tools.name: fetch_brand_guidelines
tools.description: Retrieves the stored brand guidelines document (tone, voice, style, prohibited terms, logo usage, etc.) for a given brand ID.

brand_id.description: Unique identifier of the brand whose guidelines should be returned.

tools.name: fetch_audience_insights
tools.description: Fetches audience demographic and psychographic insights (age ranges, interests, peak activity times) for a specific brand and platform.

brand_id.description: ID of the brand whose audience data is requested.

platform.description: Social platform name (e.g., instagram, twitter, facebook).

tools.name: fetch_upcoming_events
tools.description: Returns a list of relevant holidays, industry events, and custom marketing milestones occurring within a specified date range.

start_date.description: ISO date string marking the start of the window.

end_date.description: ISO date string marking the end of the window.

region.description: Geographic region code (e.g., US, EU) to filter region‑specific holidays.

tools.name: generate_post_copy
tools.description: Creates platform‑specific social‑media copy using brand guidelines, audience insights, an event description, and optional tone modifiers.

brand_guidelines.description: Full JSON representation of the brand guidelines fetched earlier.

audience_insights.description: Audience data object retrieved from fetch_audience_insights.

event.description: Object describing the event (name, date, description).

platform.description: Target social platform (instagram, twitter, linkedin, facebook).

tone.description: Optional override of the default brand tone.

tools.name: schedule_post
tools.description: Creates a scheduled post entry in the calendar service for a given platform, date‑time, and copy, returning a confirmation ID.

brand_id.description: Identifier of the brand that owns the post.

platform.description: Social platform where the post will be published.

publish_datetime.description: ISO 8601 timestamp for when the post should go live.

copy.description: The final post text generated by generate_post_copy.

media_url.description: Optional URL for an image/video asset.

tools.name: retrieve_calendar_entries
tools.description: Returns all scheduled posts for a given brand, platform, and optional date range. The result is a JSON array of entries containing entry_id, event_name, publish_datetime, copy, and media_url (if any).

platform.description: Social platform to filter on (e.g., instagram).

start_date.description: ISO date string for the start of the query window (optional).

end_date.description: ISO date string for the end of the query window (optional).

tools.name: store_calendar_entry
tools.description: Persists a calendar entry record (event, copy, schedule info) in the brand's content‑calendar database.

event_name.description: Human‑readable name of the event (e.g., "Earth Day").

media_url.description: Optional media URL associated with the post.

examples.description: User asks to create a 7‑day posting schedule for Instagram and Twitter around Earth Day. The assistant gathers brand guidelines, audience data, relevant events, generates copy, schedules posts, and stores them in the calendar.
